title: What proportion of adults with learning disabilities are in paid employment?
analysis_commentary:
It is important that people with care and support needs have an enhanced quality of life, including being able to find employment when they want. Here we look at the proportion of adults with a learning disability who are in paid employment or who are self-employed.

The proportion of adults with a learning disability known to be in paid employment has changed little over time. This has been around 6% for all years we have data. We do see some differences between the sexes however, with a higher proportion of males in employment compared to females. In 2013/14, 7.4% of males were employed compared to 5.8% of females. This gender split is something we see beyond this client group and we know employment rates in the general population are higher in men compared to women (http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/dcp171776_328352.pdf).
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care - Combined Activity Return (ASC-CAR)
